docs.abstract: For some college students who support Mr. Sanders, leaving campus means more time to phone bank, and a captive, if skeptical, audience at home.
docs.snippet: For some college students who support Mr. Sanders, leaving campus means more time to phone bank, and a captive, if skeptical, audience at home.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the country in crisis mode, Melat Eskender, 19, has assumed battle position: In her parents’ living room making phone calls for Senator Bernie Sanders, with quarantine rations of Flamin’ Hot Cheetos at her side.

headline.main: The Bernie Sanders Revolution Has Moved to Mom’s Couch
headline.print_headline: The Remote Revolution: From Mom’s Couch, Students Still Fight for Sanders

docs.abstract: Ohio postponed voting, but three other states are forging ahead: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.snippet: Ohio postponed voting, but three other states are forging ahead: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bryant Rockfield voted early at the Franklin County Board of Elections in Columbus, Ohio, on Monday.

headline.main: On Politics: Somehow, There’s Still an Election

docs.abstract: Mr. Biden said for the first time at Sunday’s Democratic debate on CNN that he would choose a woman to be his running mate.
docs.snippet: Mr. Biden said for the first time at Sunday’s Democratic debate on CNN that he would choose a woman to be his running mate.
docs.lead_paragraph: At Sunday’s Democratic debate on CNN, Joseph R. Biden Jr. said for the first time that he would choose a woman to be his running mate.

headline.main: Joe Biden Commits to Selecting a Woman as Vice President

docs.abstract: The coronavirus has left states rapidly searching for ways to protect democracy’s most sacred institution.
docs.snippet: The coronavirus has left states rapidly searching for ways to protect democracy’s most sacred institution.
docs.lead_paragraph: In Wisconsin, Democrats sued elections officials to extend voting deadlines.

headline.main: Voting by Mail Is the Hot New Idea. Is There Time to Make It Work?
headline.print_headline: Voting by Mail Gains Traction, but Challenges, and Skeptics, Are Many

byline.original: By Nick Corasaniti and Stephanie Saul

docs.abstract: New York became the latest state to move its primary in an attempt to limit the risk of spreading the virus.
docs.snippet: New York became the latest state to move its primary in an attempt to limit the risk of spreading the virus.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York will postpone its April 28 presidential primary until June 23, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced on Saturday, buying time for the state to administer an election as it struggles to respond to the escalating coronavirus outbreak.

headline.main: Cuomo Postpones New York’s Primary Election to June 23 Because of Coronavirus

docs.abstract: Criticism from Cuomo and provisions for interest groups: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.snippet: Criticism from Cuomo and provisions for interest groups: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Monday at the Javits Center in New York, where workers from the Federal Emergency Management Agency were constructing a makeshift hospital for coronavirus patients.

headline.main: On Politics: The Bill’s Being Sold. Does It Have the Goods?

docs.abstract: Joe Biden tries to break through, Bernie Sanders signals he’s staying in and another Super Tuesday (of sorts) emerges.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hello, from the socially distanced land of our comfy (read: tiny) New York apartments!

headline.main: Grappling With the Impact of Coronavirus: This Week in the 2020 Race

docs.abstract: A crisis can provide a sharper view of how candidates approach the problems facing the country.
docs.snippet: A crisis can provide a sharper view of how candidates approach the problems facing the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good morning and welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host, taking over the morning edition for our debate recap.

docs.abstract: On a swing through Michigan, I could see that the candidate wasn’t connecting with black voters.
